definition: puffed/swollen/spongy/small lake (esp. in place names)/classifier for urine or feces

bubble/foam/blister (i.e. skin bubble)/to soak/to steep/to infuse/to dawdle/to shilly-shally/to hang about/to pick up (a girl)/to get off with (a sexual partner)/classifier for occurrences of an action/classifier for number of infusions
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

sentences.english: The property is empty changing is Japan " bubble economy " one of main show.
sentences.chinese: 产业空洞化是日本“泡沫经济”的重要表现之一。

sentences.english: China in late 2007 has all the marks of a bubble economy.
sentences.chinese: 2007年下半年的中国有着各种泡沫经济的标志。

sentences.english: The pre-crisis UK economy, he says, was a “bubble economy”.
sentences.chinese: 他表示，危机前的英国经济是一个“泡沫经济”。

credit crisis/see also 次貸危機|次贷危机[ci4 dai4 wei1 ji1]

definition: subprime lending/abbr. for 次級貸款|次级贷款[ci4 ji2 dai4 kuan3]
